body: {"id":"d8825e29-ce71-4da7-a96b-659d84073c02","author":"Daniel Byun","title":"Frozen Lemonade Cake","summary":"To make this modern icebox cake, the whizzes at America’s Test Kitchen mixed lemonade concentrate into vanilla ice cream for a refreshing summer dessert beyond compare. Those contrasting (and zingy) layers are made with a combination of lemon curd and Cool Whip. And the crust? Not-too-sweet animal crackers, of course.\\n\\nThat abstract swoosh of color on top is done by dipping a paintbrush in yellow food coloring and brushing it wherever the mood takes you.\\n\\nYou’ll find this and other clever no-bake frozen dessert recipes in “The Complete Summer Cookbook: Beat the Heat with 500 Recipes that Make the Most of Summer’s Bounty” (America’s Test Kitchen, $33).","images":[],"ingredients":[{"id":0,"name":"animal crackers","amount":"5 ounces "},{"id":1,"name":"sugar","amount":"3 tablespoons"},{"id":2,"name":"table salt","amount":"Pinch"},{"id":3,"name":"unsalted butter, melted","amount":"4 tablespoons"},{"id":4,"name":"vanilla ice cream","amount":"2 pints"},{"id":5,"name":"Cool Whip Whipped Topping, thawed, divided","amount":"16 ounces"},{"id":6,"name":"frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed","amount":"1 container"},{"id":7,"name":"lemon curd","amount":"2 (10-ounce) jars"},{"id":8,"name":"yellow gel food coloring, divided","amount":"1 teaspoon"}],"steps":[{"id":0,"text":"Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 325 degrees."},{"id":1,"text":"Process crackers, sugar and salt in food processor until finely ground, about 30 seconds."},{"id":2,"text":"Add melted butter and pulse until combined, about 8 pulses. "},{"id":3,"text":"Transfer crumb mixture to greased 9‑inch springform pan."},{"id":4,"text":"Using bottom of dry measuring cup, press crumb mixture firmly into bottom of pan. Bake crust until fragrant and beginning to brown, 12 to 14 minutes."},{"id":5,"text":"Let cool completely, about 30 minutes."},{"id":6,"text":"Scoop vanilla ice cream into large bowl and, using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, break up the scoops."},{"id":7,"text":"Stir and fold ice cream to achieve smooth consistency."},{"id":8,"text":"Stir ice cream, 2½ cups whipped topping and lemonade concentrate in bowl until combined."},{"id":9,"text":"Pour half the ice cream mixture into cooled crust and smooth top with offset spatula."},{"id":10,"text":"Transfer pan and bowl with remaining ice cream mixture to freezer and freeze until firm, about 1 hour."},{"id":11,"text":"Stir lemon curd, ½ teaspoon food coloring and remaining 2½ cups whipped topping in separate bowl until combined. "},{"id":12,"text":"Spread lemon curd mixture in even layer over frozen ice cream layer."},{"id":13,"text":"Return pan to freezer until firm, about 1 hour."},{"id":14,"text":"Scoop remaining half of ice cream mixture into large bowl and, using rubber spatula or wooden spoon, break up scoops of ice cream. "},{"id":15,"text":"Stir and fold ice cream to achieve smooth consistency, then spread over frozen lemon curd layer, smoothing top with offset spatula."},{"id":16,"text":"Freeze cake until fully firm, at least 6 hours or up to 24 hours."},{"id":17,"text":"Remove sides of pan and slide thin metal spatula between crust and pan bottom to loosen, then slide cake to cake plate or pedestal."},{"id":18,"text":"Smooth sides of cake with offset spatula."},{"id":19,"text":"Dip 1‑inch paintbrush in remaining ½ teaspoon food coloring and lightly drag across top of cake, painting straight yellow stripes 2 to 3 inches long, refreshing brush with food coloring as needed."},{"id":20,"text":"Slice and serve."}]}
